Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Charybdotoxin (natural AMPs; UCSS1a; 3S=S, yellow scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBPP)
Sequence Information.Source: Identified based on gamma-core motif.Leiurus quinquestriatus hebraeus

Literature Information.Literature: Structure:  Refined structrure is reported (Bontems et al., 1991).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Activity: Antimicrobial activity was only established recently based on the gamma-core motif. Diffusion assay: active against B. subtilis, S. aureus, E. coli, and C. albicans (pH 7.5>pH 5.5).MOA: This protein appears to target K+ channel. p>Entry history: The original synthetic magainin analog was replaced 12/2009;updated 2/2014; Jan2025.
Literature Information.Author: Yount NY, Yeaman MR2004
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2004 May 11;101(19):7363-8.
Literature Information.Title: Multidimensional signatures in antimicrobial peptides.
